availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert H. Jones (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Murry Jones. Father of Sarah Ann Jones Cook, Mary J. Jones, Thomas H. Jones, Samuel S. Jones, and Susan E. Jones. Served in Company D 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from September 13, 1862, to April 1, 1864. Captured and paroled at the Battle of Munfordville, Kentucky, on September 17, 1862. Served in Company K 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from April 1, 1864, to July 4, 1864. Died in a hospital in Bowling Green, Kentucky, after being hit with the butt of a gun by a fellow Union soldier on July 4, 1864.
